reviewText:
Country Tales
[Disclamer - I was provided a copy of by the publisher for review purposes]

The good
Addictive gameplay
Good difficulty curve
The not so good:
Annoying cinematics
The conclusion:
If you like time management games then Country Tales will keep you engaged for at least 10 to 20 hours. You build sawmills, then you buy wood, then you build houses, you feed your minions, collect rent and rinse and repeat, with each area adding a new type of building and a new challenge. And you pray time doesn’t run out on you.
Honestly, the game doesn’t distinguish itself at all from similar titles. In the last 5 years I feel like the recipe for “time management games” hasn’t changed a bit and I played dozens, all of them so similar that I can’t even remember their names. They all feel like they were made in the same workshop and someone there just doesn’t wanna give up on the boring, cutesy “cinematics” that tell a boring, cutesy story.
In any case, there’s nothing actually wrong with Country Tales, it’s a very well done and relaxing game, I haven’t found any bugs and I really enjoyed hunting golden stars.
You can see me collecting resources and fixing up Indian tents here - https://youtu.be/EZJeD8p7dkE

reviewText: Relaxing time management game. The characters are likable, the setting is appealing. I have played for a few hours and the game runs smoothly.

reviewText: If you enjoy this type of game, then you will love this.  When playing on timed levels I found a few that were hard to get done, but it is possible.  The story is cute but corny and the finish is predictable, but over all I found it to be a fun game. I definately give it a thumbs up !
